instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: 17 inch 2010  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , no keyboard no touchpad
threads.message:
this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from 2010 17 inch shows only keyboard and mouse
image on the screen .
disconnect everything from the board not solving the issue .
tried new keyboard , new drive , nothing works .
please check images .

threads.title: 17 inch 2010  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , no keyboard no touchpad
threads.message: Board not recognizing touchpad or keyboard at all.

threads.title: 17 inch 2010  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , no keyboard no touchpad
threads.message:
Start checking voltages on correspondent connectors.
Next, check continuity to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.
Search for any bad solder, or corroded resistor/trace around the chip.

threads.title: 17 inch 2010  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , no keyboard no touchpad
threads.message:
The no liquid damage to this board and no corrosion around 
<CHIP>U5701</CHIP> !
could it be just bad <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> .
